label: Elevation of the Host
location: New York, Columbia University, Barnard College Library,  MS 1, p. 189
description: An antiphonal from mid-14th-century Italy, but depicting the Elevation of the Consecrated Host at Mass.

label: Sequence for Continents (chaste spouses)
location: New York, Columbia University, Barnard College Library,  MS 3, f. 22v
description: A gradual from 16th-century Portugal.

label: Melodies for the Kyrie
location: New York, Columbia University, Barnard College Library,  MS 3, f. 40v
description: A gradual from 16th-century Portugal.

label: Kyries for Marian Feasts, Preceded by a Trope
location: New York, Columbia University, Barnard College Library,  MS 3, f. 42v
description: A gradual from 16th-century Portugal.

label: Troped Glorias
location: New York, Columbia University, Barnard College Library,  MS 3, f. 49r
description: A gradual from 16th-century Portugal.

label: Introit for the Feast of the Dedication of a Church
location: New York, Columbia University, Barnard College Library,  MS 3, f. 7v
description: A gradual from 16th-century Portugal.

label: Rubricated Calendar with Feast Rankings
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Benjamin MS 3, ff. 4v-5r
description: A ferial psalter from 15th-century Germany whose calendar includes, in red ink, the feasts of Dominic 'patris nostri' ranked as 'totum duplex' (5 August) and Sebaldus (19 August) showing that the book was made for the Dominicans of Nurnberg.

label: Processional Chants for the Feast of the Purification
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Benjamin MS 2, ff. 6v-7r
description: Processional from a nuns' convent in 15th-century Italy showing the rubrics for the processions on the Feast of the Purification.

label: Introit for the Feast of Saints Peter and Paul
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Plimpton MS 040A, f. 1r
description: A gradual from 15th-century Italy with an image of the canons of S. Giorgio in Alga kneeling before Sts. Peter and Paul.

label: Foliation in the Right Margin
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Med/Ren Frag. 005, f. 1r
description: A missal from 15th-century Italy foliated 'lxxx' in the upper right margin.

label: Pontifical Containing the Rites of the Bishop
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Med/Ren Frag. 062, f. 1v
description: A leaf from a pontifical copied in Italy during the 15th century with the beginning of the service for the confirmation of children.

label: Liturgical Commentary by Durandus of Mende
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Med/Ren Frag. 071, f. 1v
description: A leaf from the Rationale divinorum officiorum of Durandus in holster format for portability, produced in Germany during the 15th century.

label: Texts for the Office with Instructions in Red Ink
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Med/Ren Frag. 009, f. 1r
description: A breviary from 15th-century Italy.

label: Bible with Interlinear and Marginal Exegetical Commentary
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Smith Med/Ren Frag. 24, f. 1r
description: A glossed Bible from 13th-century Flanders.

label: Fragment with Office Reading
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Smith Med/Ren Frag. 26, verso
description: An office lectionary from 12th-century Italy.

label: Notated Mass Proper Chants
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Med/Ren Frag. 028, f. 2r
description: A gradual from 12th-century Germany.

label: Gospel Reading and Prayers with Chant Incipits in Smaller Script
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Med/Ren Frag. 086, f. 1v
description: A missal from 12th-century Italy.

label: Antiphons for Advent
location: New York, Columbia University, Gabe M. Wiener Music and Arts Library,  Music Deposit 00, f. 2r
location_short: Gabe M. Wiener Music and Arts Library, Music Deposit 00, f. 2r
description: An antiphoner from 16th-century Italy.

label: Roman Dating System
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Plimpton MS 135, f. 16r
description: A grammar copied in Italy in 1503 with a chart giving the numeric date equivalencies for the designations in Roman style by kalends, nones, and ides.

label: Calculations for Easter
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Plimpton MS 170, f. 64v
description: A copy of Bono da Lucca, <em>Computus solaris et lunaris<em>, produced in Italy during the 1390s with an Easter chart to the year 1882 (new style).

label: Calendar Commemorating the Dedication of a Church
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Plimpton MS 176, f. 5r
description: A calendar produced in Switzerland in 1426, with the Dedication of the church of Constance (9 September) written by the same scribe as the bulk of the text.

label: Mnemonic for Calculating Easter
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Plimpton MS 211, ff. 137v-138r
description: An early 16th-century Italian treatise on arithmetic with a mnemonic hand for the date of Easter.

label: Historiated Initial for St. Helen
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Plimpton MS 040B, f. 1r
description: A gradual from 15th-century Italy with an inordinately large historiated initial of a relatively unimportant saint,  Helen, who found the True Cross (18 August). Presumably the book was made for a church with particular veneration of St. Helen.

label: Foliation in the Upper Margin
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Plimpton MS 040C, f. 3r
description: A choir book copied in Genoa during the 13th century foliated 'xxiiii' in the center upper margin.

label: Bible with Passages Assigned to Various Dates
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Plimpton Add. MS 03, f. 45r
description: A Middle English Wycliffite Bible from late 14th- or early 15th-century England with lists of the readings.

label: Notated Office Chants and Readings
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Plimpton MS 033, recto
description: An breviary from 12th-century Italy containing both the notated chants and the readings.

label: Processional Chants for the Feast of the Purification
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Plimpton MS 034, f. 1r
description: Processional chants for the Feast of the Purification (2 February) in a processional from 14th-century Flanders.

label: Priest Reading the Words of Consecration
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Plimpton MS 035, f. 89r
description: A missal from late-14th-century Italy with the priest reading from the Canon of the Mass, 'Hic est corpus meum, ' 'This is my body.'

label: Incipits and Page References for Chants Notated Elsewhere
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Plimpton MS 040C, f. 2v
description: A gradual from 13th-century Italy with an image of the Annunciation.

label: Psalter Rubricated with Liturgical Assignments
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Plimpton MS 040G, f. 1r
description: A choir psalter from 15th-century Italy.

label: Beginning of the Sanctorale
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Plimpton MS 041, f. 1r
description: An antiphoner from 15th-century Italy.

label: Hymns for the Office
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Plimpton MS 042, f. 1v
description: A hymnary from 15th-century Germany.

label: Patristic Readings for the Office
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Plimpton MS 050, f. 11v
description: Ambrose's commentary on Luke, adapted for liturgical use, from 12th-century France.

label: Homily Texts for the Office
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Plimpton MS 055, f. 1v
description: A homiliary from 9th-century France containing a composite text, attributed in the margin to Bede the Venerable, that juxtaposes parts of various homiletic and exegetical texts.

label: Legendary of Hagiographic Texts for the Office
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Plimpton MS 064, f. 2v
description: A legendary from 11th-century central Italy showing the deeds of saints Cyprian and Justina, who were commemorated on September 26.

label: Beginning of the Rule of Benedict
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Plimpton MS 084, f. 103r
description: A Martyrology of Usuard and Rule of Benedict from France, around 1500.

label: Martyrology for September 15 and 16 with the Phases of the Moon
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Plimpton MS 084, f. 66v
description: A Martyrology of Usuard and Rule of Benedict from France, around 1500.

label: First Page of the Martyrology (Dec. 24 and 25)
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Plimpton MS 084, f. 9r
description: A Martyrology of Usuard and Rule of Benedict from France, around 1500.

location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Plimpton MS 254, f. 3v April
description: A copy of the Kalendarium of John Somer produced in England c. 1417.

label: Mass Texts and Rubrics without Musical Notation
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Plimpton MS 265, back flyleaf
description: A missal from 15th-century England.

label: Wycliffite List of Gospel Assignments in Middle English
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Plimpton MS 268, ff. 1v-2r
description: A 15th-century English copy of Clement of Lanthony, Harmony of the Gospels with lists of the readings.

label: Diagram of the Celestial Bodies
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Smith Western Add. MS 01, ff. 60v-61r
description: A 14th-century Italian manuscript of Johannes de Sacrobosco's Computus ecclesiasticus with a diagram of the celestial bodies.

label: Office Readings from the Book of Wisdom and the Gospel of Mark
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Smith Med/Ren Frag. 14, f. 1r
description: An office lectionary from 12th-century Switzerland.

label: Proper Readings with Chants from the Commons
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Smith Western MS 15, ff. 30v-31r
description: A breviary from 15th-century Italy, where the rubric for the feast of the Holy Innocents (28 December) on f. 30v in the second column begins, 'In sanctorum innocentium Invitatorium, ymni, antiphone nocturnales, psalmi, versiculi dicuntur de communi plurimorum martirum...' while the readings, proper to the feast, are given in full.

label: Office Texts and Chants Notated in Aquitanian Neumes
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Smith Western MS 16, f. 116v
description: A breviary from 12th-century Auvergne.

label: Notated Missal
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Smith Med/Ren Frag. 22, verso
description: A missal from late-11th-century France notated with neumes.

label: End of the Sanctorale and Beginning of the Commons
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Smith Western MS 24, ff. 297v-298r
description: A breviary copied during the middle years of the 15th century in France, showing on the verso the end of the sanctorale with a rubric for a prayer of Saturnini martiris (29 November), and on the facing recto, the decorated opening of the following text section, 'Incipit commune sanctorum, primo de communi unius apostoli...,' assigning the rank of 'duplex' to the feasts of apostles.

label: List of Invitatory Antiphons and Hymn, \'Primo dierum\'
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Typographical MS 2, f. 1r
description: A psalter from 15th-century Tuscany.

label: Antiphon, 'Confortate manus dissolutas'
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Typographical MS 2, f. 15r detail
description: A psalter from 15th-century Tuscany.

label: Canticle, 'Benedictus'
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Typographical MS 2, f. 46r
description: A psalter from 15th-century Tuscany.

label: Initial of Zacharias Holding a Scroll with the Artist's Name
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Typographical MS 2, f. 46r detail
description: A psalter from 15th-century Tuscany.

label: Hymn, 'Consors paterni luminis lux'
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Typographical MS 2, f. 81r
description: A psalter from 15th-century Tuscany.

label: Mass Chants for Various Feasts
location: New York, Columbia University, Burke Library at Union Theological Seminary,  UTS MS 003, f. 129v
description: Melodies for the Gloria, Ite Missa Est, and Benedicamus Domino in a missal from 15th-century Germany.

label: Larger Script of the Canon Visible Underneath the Page
location: New York, Columbia University, Burke Library at Union Theological Seminary,  UTS MS 003, f. 135v
description: A missal from 15th-century Germany with the initial for Trinity Sunday cut away showing the larger script for the Canon of the Mass on the preceding leaf.

label: Beginning of the Temporale with Advent
location: New York, Columbia University, Burke Library at Union Theological Seminary,  UTS MS 019, ff. 14v-15r
description: A collectar from 15th-century Germany with the beginning, on the recto, of a new text section at Advent, 'In adventu domini Dominica prima, ad primas vesperas.'

label: Office Combining Proper and Common Chants
location: New York, Columbia University, Burke Library at Union Theological Seminary, UTS MS 003, f. 219r
description: A missal from 15th-century Germany, where the service for Magnus, 'apostle of the Allgäu' (Bavaria, 6 September), is contained partially here in the sanctorale with a note in the rubric on finding the rest of the service, 'Secretum et complenda de comune de confessore non pontifice...' in the common of a confessor, not a bishop.

label: Procession of Christmas
location: New York, Columbia University, Burke Library at Union Theological Seminary,  UTS MS 043, f. 96v-97r
description: The beginning of the procession for Christmas in a processional from 16th-century Germany.

label: Necrology with Names Continually Added
location: New York, Columbia University, Burke Library at Union Theological Seminary,  UTS MS 060, ff. 6v-7r
description: A necrology from a nunnery in 15th-century Germany showing the addition of commemorations over a long period.

label: Various Authors' Dating of Christ's Passion
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Western MS 031, p. 406
description: A computistical and theological compendium copied in the Low Countries ca. 1450-75, with several dates given for Christ's passion, according to Theophilus, according to Jerome, according to Hugh of St. Victor, and according to 'others.'

label: Book of the Gospels
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Western MS 029, f. 63r
description: A Gospel lectionary from Spain, ca. 1577.

label: Divisions of the Psalter
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Western MS 038, ff. 136v-137r
description: Psalm 109 begins the 8th section in the eight-part division of the psalter.

label: Litany of the Saints
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Western MS 038, ff. 193v-194r
description: A ferial psalter from fifteenth-century Austria.

label: Psalter with Chant Incipits Added
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  Western MS 049, recto
description: A psalter from 12th-century Germany adapted to liturgical use through the addition of antiphons at the bottom of the page.

label: Mass Prayers with Sung Chants Indicated by Smaller Script
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Western MS 062, f. 2v
description: A missal from 15th-century Germany.

label: Golden Numbers and Dominical Letters
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  X936.C28, f. 1r
description: A missal from 15th-century Germany, with the calendar page for January in columns from the left:  the Golden Numbers; the Dominical Letters; the Roman system of kalends, nones and ides; the saints with the more important entries in red (red letter days).

label: Page of Liturgical Rubrics in Red Ink
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  X936.C28, f. 7r
description: A missal from 15th-century Germany.

label: Fully Notated Recitational Passages for the Priest
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library,  X936.C28, f. 121v
description: A notated Preface and the Dialogue before the Preface for feasts of the Apostles in a missal from 15th-century Germany.

label: Alleluia Verses for the Commons of Saints
location: New York, Columbia University, Rare Book and Manuscript Library, X936.C28, f. 214r
description: A missal from mid-15th-century Germany with the non-notated Alleluia verses for the hierarchy of saints listed in order (apostles, many martyrs, one martyr, one confessor, virgins).

label: The Olivetan Gradual
location: New Haven, Yale University, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, MS 1184
description: The Olivetan Gradual (Beinecke MS 1184) is a stunning 15th-century example of the gradual, a liturgical book containing the musical components of the Mass in written notation. (Reproduction courtesy of the Beinecke Rare Book & Manuscript Library)
